title: Dragan Čadikovski
text:
Dragan Čadikovski (; born 13 January 1982) is a <a href="Serbia">Serbia</a>n-born <a href="Macedonians%20in%20Serbia">Macedonian</a> professional <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a> who plays as a <a href="Forward%20%28association%20football%29%23Striker">striker</a> for Serbian amateur club TEK Sloga and is also the assistant coach of <a href="FK%20Kolubara">FK Kolubara</a>. He also holds <a href="Slovenian%20nationality%20law">Slovenian citizenship</a>.
Club career.
After starting out at <a href="FK%20Kolubara">Kolubara</a>, Čadikovski moved abroad to Slovenia and joined <a href="NK%20Celje">Publikum Celje</a> in the summer of 2001. He spent three and a half seasons at the club, scoring 22 <a href="Slovenian%20PrvaLiga">league</a> goals and earning a transfer to Russian club <a href="FC%20Zenit%20Saint%20Petersburg">Zenit Saint Petersburg</a> in the 2004–05 winter transfer window.
In January 2008, Čadikovski returned to his country of birth and signed a three-year contract with <a href="FK%20Partizan">Partizan</a>. He helped the team win <a href="Double%20%28association%20football%29">the double</a> in the remainder of <a href="2007%E2%80%9308%20FK%20Partizan%20season">the season</a>. A year after joining Partizan, Čadikovski was transferred to <a href="K%20League">K League</a> side <a href="Incheon%20United%20FC">Incheon United</a>.
International career.
He made his senior debut for <a href="Macedonia%20national%20football%20team">Macedonia</a> in a January 2004 <a href="friendly%20match">friendly match</a> away against <a href="China%20national%20football%20team">China</a> and has earned a total of 8 caps, scoring no goals. His final international was a February 2005 <a href="FIFA%20World%20Cup%20qualification">FIFA World Cup qualification</a> match against <a href="Andorra%20national%20football%20team">Andorra</a> in Skopje.
Coaching career.
On 13 January 2020, Čadikovski announced his retirement from professional football. Čadikovski, however, continued for <a href="FK%20Kolubara">FK Kolubara</a> as a youth coach and assistant coach of the clubs first team. During 2020, he also played matches with FK TEK Sloga.
